repnme.cdata!:
Afghanistan - Short Term Urban Water Supply
            and Sanitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Short Term Urban Water
            Supply and Sanitation Project for Afghanistan were as
            follows: outcomes were unsatisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was high; Bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory and grantee performance was also moderately
            unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: in a post
            conflict environment the project design should be kept
            fairly simple with minimal possible components, focused
            geographical scope and relatively straight forward
            development objectives. There is a tendency to rush through
            the project preparation in emergency situations without
            giving due attention to implementation challenges.
            Investment of time in assessing the capacity of the
            borrower, implementation entity as well as the private
            sector at the design stage pays off during the
            implementation phase. Risk is inherently high in the
            post-conflict period in Afghanistan.
